business.headline: Why are foreign investors exiting India? 3 reasons behind stock market selloffExperts suggest that the trajectory of future FPI flows will largely depend on how India maintains macroeconomic stability and improves corporate earnings.

I don't believe in work-life balance: Narayana MurthyNarayana Murthy said that hard work is key to national progress, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's long work hours as an example.

Since the start of 2024, the stock has risen by over 110%, moving from Rs 15.25 to Rs 32.50 per share.

SBI hikes home loan interest rates by 5 basis points. Check details  The change in interest rates is effective from November 15, and will make borrowing costs slightly higher for customers seeking loans from the State Bank of India (SBI).

Signature Global shares at over Rs 2,000? These 2 brokerages are bullishShares of Signature Global rose nearly 3.5% in the previous trading session after multiple brokerages raised their target price. Its total market capitalisation stands at 18,238.99 crore.

I'll take this with me to grave: Narayana Murthy defends 6-day workweek viewNarayana Murthy, who has been vocal about his views on work ethics and productivity, expressed disappointment over India's move from a six-day workweek to a five-day one in 1986.

'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Report flags Starlink's US military tiesStarlink operates through a constellation of satellites to provide internet access worldwide, a model distinct from traditional telecom services that rely on ground-based towers.

Stock markets closed today for Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday?Sensex and Nifty, have faced a six-session losing streak, marked by selling pressure from foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and worries over rising retail inflation.
Siemens layoffs: Tech giant may cut up to 5,000 jobs amid ongoing strugglesThe company's Q4 FY 2024 results highlighted the impact of global geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges.

Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight session as FMCG stocks decline sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 110.64 points lower at 77,580.31 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.35 points to 23,532.70.

More trouble for Ola Electric, faces probe over poor service standards: ReportThis comes after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) issued a notice to the SoftBank-backed e-scooter maker following a high volume of complaints.

Boeing layoffs: Aerospace giant to reduce workforce by 17,000Boeing Layoffs: The aerospace giant has faced financial challenges this year, pushing it to make these deep cuts to realign its current financial realities.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Kailash Gahlot quits AAP, says party facing 'embarrassing controversies'Delhi Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Kailash Gahlot resigned from primary membership of of the party on Sunday (November 17).

Manipur wants AFSPA revoked as violence flares up, Biren Singh's house targetedViolence erupted in Manipur on Saturday after the bodies of six people, who had gone missing from a relief camp in Jiribam, were recovered.

India successfully tests first long-range hypersonic missile, joins select clubWith the successful test of a long-range hypersonic missile, capable of carrying various payloads over distances exceeding 1500 km, India has entered the elite group of nations possessing advanced military capabilities.

Nirmala Sitharaman to X user's plea for middle class relief: Centre is responsiveFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman engaged with a social media user who raised concerns about the financial pressures on the middle class. She assured that the government is committed to addressing these issues with ongoing and future initiatives.

Indian women storm whisky world, make alcobev companies take noteIndian women, long considered wine and cocktail connoisseurs, are experimenting and drinking whisky in such large numbers that they are making whisky makers take note and create products for them. This is how women in India are influencing whiskies and shaping the whisky world.

Mob attacks ex-BJP MP Navneet Rana's rally in Maharashtra, throws chairs at herNavneet Rana alleged that during her speech in Maharashtra's Amravati, some individuals made obscene gestures and chanted communal slogans before chairs were thrown at her.

Happy and healthy: Sunita Williams looks at Earth from her home in spaceSunita Williams's enthusiasm for her work is evident as she continues to contribute to groundbreaking advancements in space exploration.

Jhansi hospital fire: Two-member probe committee report rules out foul play The report, prepared by a team led by Jhansi Commissioner Vipul Dubey and DIG Kalanidhi Naithani, said that there was no criminal conspiracy or foul play involved.

Why Isro is relying on Elon Musk's SpaceX to launch Indian satelliteThe satellite is designed to enhance India's communication infrastructure, featuring a Ka-band high-throughput communications payload with a mission lifespan of 14 years.

The Purge: Why Donald Trump wants to slash bureaucracy in the USPresident-elect Donald Trump's plans to dismantle federal bureaucracy stem from his belief that the US government is plagued by inefficiency, waste, and excessive regulation.

Let us revisit Naanum Rowdy Dhaan, a film that changed the dynamics between Nayanthara and Dhanush forever.

Delhi suffocates in severe pollution; smog delays over 100 flights, 3 cancelled Delhi Pollution: Visibility at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport dropped to 800 meters at 7:30 am, leading to 107 flights being delayed and 3 cancelled, according to Flightradar.

sports.headline: Watch: Jon Jones does the 'Donald Trump Dance' in front of US President-electUFC Heavyweight champion Jon Jones decided to celebrate his win at UFC 309 over Stipe Miocic by doing the 'Donald Trump Dance' inside Madison Square Garden with the US President-elect in attendance.

Jon Jones not retiring after retaining Heavyweight title vs Stipe MiocicUFC Heavyweight champion Jon Jones has confirmed that he will not be retiring after retaining his Heavyweight title against Stipe Miocic at Madison Square Garden on November 16, Saturday.

The tournament will feature 32 top clubs from around the world and will take place from June 15 to July 13.

When Virat Kohli was angered by Steve Smith's bizarre DRS tactics  Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Virat Kohli and Steve Smith were involved in a controversy surrounding a DRS call when India and Australia faced each other in the Bengaluru Test back in 2017.  India won the Test by 75 runs and made it 1-1 in the four-match series.

I almost died: Mike Tyson hints at retirement, recalls health battleLegendary Mike Tyson took to X after his fight against Logan Paul and opened up on the health scare that he faced before the bout. Tyson revealed that he almost died in June and had to begin his training from scratch to get ready for the November 15 fight. He also hinted at his retirement.
ICC announces 2025 Champions Trophy trophy tourICC's Champions Trophy tour starts in Pakistan, moves to India in January, skipping Kashmir.

Told myself to fight: Fritz after securing historic ATP Finals title matchTaylor Fritz defeated Alexander Zverev in a dramatic ATP Finals clash, becoming the first American in 18 years to reach the title match. Fritz's resilience and precision under pressure secured a hard-fought victory in Turin's semi-final showdown.

Ayush Badoni credits LSG coach Justin Langer after hitting double ton in RanjiAyush Badoni scored an unbeaten 205 as Delhi managed a draw against Jharkhand in the Ranji Trophy match. Badoni credited Justin Langer for his growth over time in the sport.

Jurel transitions to 'alarm-free' mornings as he gears up for Australia TestsDhruv Jurel shared snippets from his photo-shoot ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. He captioned the post, "From setting alarms to catch India's Tests in Australia to waking up alarm-free."

Alcaraz backs 'dangerous' and 'hungry' Djokovic for strong comebackCarlos Alcaraz backed Novak Djokovic to make a strong comeback in the upcoming season. Djokovic won the gold medal in the Paris Olympics, but failed to win any other tournament.

Arshdeep Singh's rise has been exceptional: Dinesh Karthik praises pacerArshdeep Singh's meteoric T20I rise sees him near India's all-time wicket-taking record. Praised by Dinesh Karthik, the pacer's consistency and skill have made him invaluable, with his 2024 T20 World Cup heroics further solidifying his reputation.

Shami dedicates his all-round show in Ranji to fans as Bengal win a thrillerMohammed Shami dedicated his all-round performance in the Ranji match for Bengal to his fans. Bengal beat Madhya Pradesh by 11 runs in the Group C clash.

Prickly coach Gautam Gambhir not a great fit for Indian team: Tim Paine Tim Paine criticised Gautam Gambhir for his coaching style and called him a 'prickly character'. Gambhir hitting back at Ponting over Kohli's criticism did not sit well with Paine.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
